intro: Jacobinia pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered jacobinia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. This species is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
